body_html:
There's also "enable_soft_placement" -- in 0.9,
tf.Session(tf.ConfigProto()) gave session without soft placement,
tf.Session() gave session with soft placement

On Fri, Jul 29, 2016 at 4:01 PM, Vijay Vasudevan notifications@github.com
wrote:

Okay, that's good to know. The only other thing that the function does is
deal with device placement, so it would be good to see the difference
between your examples by finding a difference using
log_device_placement=True. That is, test_session() and tf.Session() with
log_device_placement=True might be different in your use cases, and that
might be highlighting either a bug, or numerical differences.

Can you provide a small test case that we can use to validate?

—

body:
There's also "enable_soft_placement" -- in 0.9,
tf.Session(tf.ConfigProto()) gave session without soft placement,
tf.Session() gave session with soft placement

On Fri, Jul 29, 2016 at 4:01 PM, Vijay Vasudevan notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Okay, that's good to know. The only other thing that the function does is
> deal with device placement, so it would be good to see the difference
> between your examples by finding a difference using
> log_device_placement=True. That is, test_session() and tf.Session() with
> log_device_placement=True might be different in your use cases, and that
